Name: ls
Description: Lists files and directories in the current location.
Notes: Commonly used to inspect directory contents.

Name: cd
Description: Changes the current working directory to another directory.
Notes: Use 'cd ..' to move to the parent directory.

Name: pwd
Description: Shows the absolute path of the current directory.
Notes: Useful when navigating deep directory structures.

Name: mkdir
Description: Creates a new directory in the file system.

Name: rm
Description: Removes files or directories from the system.
Notes: Be careful â€” deleted files cannot be recovered.

Name: cp
Description: Copies files or directories to a new location.

Name: mv
Description: Moves or renames files and directories.

Name: cat
Description: Displays the content of a file on the terminal.
Notes: Often used to quickly read small files.
